draw.tools

Class Tools

  • java.lang.Object
    • draw.tools.Tools
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Iterable<PaletteEntry>

    public class Tools
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Iterable<PaletteEntry>
    Registry of all tools. Follows Singleton Design pattern. Only one tool is active at a time. The select tool is known in advance and is stored once it is registered.

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static Tools getInstance()
        Retrieve singleton instance of Tools.
        Returns:
        Singleton instance.

      • getSelectTool

        public PaletteEntry getSelectTool()
        Access the selected tool. This is a special tool that always exists.
        Returns:
        Return the (always available) Select action.

      • getTool

        public PaletteEntry getTool(java.lang.String name)
        Retrieves the desired tool by name.
        Parameters:
        name - desired tool
        Returns:
        PaletteEntry with the give name, should it exist.

      • setActiveTool

        public void setActiveTool(PaletteEntry entry)
        Set active tool.
        Parameters:
        entry - entry to select
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if no entry already exists to matches entry

      • getActiveTool

        public PaletteEntry getActiveTool()
                           throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Get active tool.
        Returns:
        Action associated with the active tool.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if no active tool yet set.

      • register

        public void register(PaletteEntry entry)
        Register a new entry with the tool repository. The first added tool becomes the active one. When a tool with name Select.selectName is added, its entry is stored as being the special Select tool.
        Parameters:
        entry - new entry to be added
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if entry already exists that matches entry.

      • iterator

        public java.util.Iterator<PaletteEntry> iterator()
        Returns list of all registered actions.
        Specified by:
        iterator in interface java.lang.Iterable<PaletteEntry>
